emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Autonomous Code Development
emerging_technologies.description: AI systems that can independently develop, test, and deploy software applications based on high-level requirements.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduces human error, increases efficiency, but poses significant job displacement risks in coding professions.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Requires robust security measures, acceptance of AI in critical systems, and regulatory frameworks.

emerging_technologies.name: Neural-Linked Virtual Reality
emerging_technologies.description: VR experiences enhanced by direct neural interfaces for immersive control and sensory feedback.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Potential for groundbreaking therapeutic applications but raises privacy and ethical concerns regarding brain data.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Acceptance of brain-computer interfaces, safety regulations, and technological maturity.

emerging_technologies.name: Decentralized Energy Grids
emerging_technologies.description: Blockchain-enabled smart grids that allow for peer-to-peer energy trading and microgrid management.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Promotes energy independence, reduces reliance on centralized power, but faces challenges with scalability and grid stability.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Regulatory support, technological infrastructure, and consumer trust in blockchain security.

emerging_technologies.name: Space-Based Solar Power
emerging_technologies.description: Collection of solar power in space and beaming it to Earth for consumption.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Could provide limitless clean energy but involves high initial costs and geopolitical challenges.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Technological breakthroughs in space travel, international cooperation, and investment in space infrastructure.

emerging_technologies.name: Privacy-Preserving AI
emerging_technologies.description: AI systems designed to operate on encrypted data without decrypting it, ensuring privacy while using AI.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Enhances data privacy, but requires new standards for AI ethics and security.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Legal frameworks for data protection, technological maturity, and integration into existing AI applications.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI Coding Assistants
mainstream_technologies.description: Tools like Copilot and @cursor_ai become standard in the software development lifecycle, aiding in code writing and debugging.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widely adopted by software companies and developers, significantly altering coding practices.

mainstream_technologies.name: Autonomous Delivery Vehicles
mainstream_technologies.description: Vehicles capable of delivering goods autonomously, reducing human involvement in logistics.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Common in urban environments, with regulatory frameworks established for operation.

epoch_themes.description: Deep integration of AI in daily life and business operations, enhancing efficiency and automation.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Significant shifts in job markets, potential for increased productivity, and new forms of work.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increased investment in AI education and ethical AI frameworks.

epoch_themes.description: Shift towards sustainable energy solutions and the decentralization of energy production.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Promotes energy democratization, environmental benefits, but requires new economic models.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Global push for green energy, regulatory changes to support renewable energy adoption.
